fields_draw.fields_draw_help_text: Indicate the hourly cost plus the structure cost
If "yes" is set, the user will have to change the password on his first login
Salt should be a random string and it will be use to crypt or decrypt private data or to enable the "login force" action in users list.

If you specify a passepartout you can use this password in the login page to access every user's account. This will only work for active users. Insert the md5 of the password. You can calculate it here: http://www.md5.cz/
If set "no" you can't have two users with the same email.

raw_data_install.users_manager_configurations_password_va:
Password requirements:
At least one number
At least one lowercase letter
At least one uppercase letter
At least one special character of following ones: @$!%*?&
At least 8 chars

apilib->view('users', $value_id); $avatar = (!empty($user['users_avatar'])) ? "uploads/".$user['users_avatar'] : 'images/user.png'; $stato_utente = $user['users_active']; if($user['users_active']==1){ $stato_utente = "Si"; }else{ $stato_utente = "No"; } ?>

actions.grids_actions_html: apilib->searchFirst('users_manager_configurations'); $im_admin = $this->datab->is_admin($this->auth->get('users_id')); $is_admin = $this->datab->is_admin($row_data['users_id']); $is_active = $row_data['users_active']; $salt = $configurations['users_manager_configurations_salt']; $group_permission = $configurations['users_manager_configurations_login_force_permission']; $user_type = $this->auth->get('users_type'); if ( $is_active && ( $im_admin || ( !$im_admin && $group_permission == $user_type && !$is_admin ) ) ): ?>

array with all record data * $this => native CodeIgniter instance (usefull to execute queries, get input vars, session data, etc...) * * Placeholders * {value_id} => current record id * {base_url} => baseurl (ends with "/") * * Example 1: * text * * Example 2: * debug($row_data); //This will generate a print_r/var_dump of the record (usefull when you want to detect all keys available in $row_data * echo($this->auth->get('users_id')); //Print id of the current logged user */ ?>
